page.title: 11BOATING
page.content: We counted the boats on a half mile stretch of the river.There were 208 boats altogether of many shapes and sizes.Many of them were small rowing boats beached on the mud which are probably used either for pleasure or for people to row out to larger yachts and cabin cruisers.There were fifteen barges,some fishing boats and the rest were yachts and pleasure craft. There is a yacht club at the bottom end of the promenade from which lots of races take place.People use some of the barges as their home.They provide quite spacious living accomodation. Many of the boats are marked with a number such as MN180 and MN89 to show they were registered in Maldon.
